{"step_by_step_thinking": "The maxillary molars are differentiated by several traits, but the most constant and valuable one is the relative position of the DL (distolingual) groove. This is because the DL groove is a unique feature that varies in position among the 1st, 2nd, and 3rd molars. The ML (mesiolingual) groove, ML cusp size, and oblique ridge size can also vary, but these are not as consistent or distinctive as the DL groove.", "answer_choice": "A"}
